segments.text: if you can choose , will you marry a foreigner or a Chinese ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: why ? Did tom pop the question ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: not yet . But I wonder if I can get my parents ’ consent .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: let me guess , your parents want you to marry a Chinese man , right ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: you are right . It is giving me a real headache . I feel like I ’ m between a rock and a hard place .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I used to have the same problem when I was with my ex .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: oh , how did you deal with it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I just let it go and continued dating with my Korean boyfriend . But finally we broke up .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: oh , it ’ s a pity . What was the matter ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: simple . We had personality clashes and there were too many cultural differences .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: he hoped to live in the Korean way and asked me to give up working and stay at home to take care of the family .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , I see . In their culture women should put family first .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: yes , he said it would be batter for me and for the whole family . But I simply can not quit working .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: so that's why it ’ s hard to have a happy marriage with a foreigner .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: not really . There are many successful mixed marriage around us .
segments.speaker: S2
